title: 115_hr6659
content: The "Screening With Dignity Act of 2018" is the short title of the Act. It focuses on TSA screening procedures and training. The Administrator must develop procedures for screening transgender passengers within 60 days of the Act's enactment. Training for Transportation Security Officers on these procedures must begin within 90 days. The Administrator must develop procedures for screening transgender passengers with the participation of community groups representing the transgender traveler population. SEC. 3. Protection of passengers. The Administrator must ensure passenger screening includes: prohibition on human viewing of images, no retention of image data, alternative to imaging scans, pat-downs by requested gender, private screening option, and minimal clothing removal with visual privacy. The passenger is provided with visual privacy in a private screening area, and there is a prohibition on profiling or discrimination based on various factors. SEC. 4. REPORT ON SCREENING EQUIPMENT. The Administrator will study the cost and feasibility of upgrading screening equipment to distinguish between objects and body parts in a gender-neutral manner. A report will be submitted to relevant committees. SEC. 5. REPORT ON ADVANCED IMAGING TECHNOLOGY. The Administrator will conduct a study on the impact of advanced imaging technology on transgender and gender nonconforming passengers. A report will be submitted to relevant committees within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. The report will contain recommendations to reduce the impact of screening on transgender passengers, with input from community groups representing the transgender traveler population. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. The term "Administrator" refers to the Administrator of the Transportation Security Administration. "Advanced imaging technology" is defined as per the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012. "Gender identity" encompasses an individual's gender-related characteristics regardless of their designated sex at birth.
